page.title: 20SAVING OUR COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: Last December,1984, we planted 60 trees at Beaudesert Nature Reserve and two sacks of acorns!This summer we planted 40 native trees in our school field. We made a nature reserve with bog garden which has a plastic lining, and many rare wild flowers.We also have adopted a special area in Gorsey Lane to look after. We hope people in 100 years time will like them{M.Green} We are trying to provide a wide range of habitats for wild plants and animals within a small area of the school field,to promote the wellbeing of local wild species.We have a hedgerow,a ditch and we have planted young trees.We have also put up two bird boxes to encourage Blue Tits nesting.The area will be a place where plant ande animal life can be studied in its natural enviroment.{Silvermead}
